com.github.zk1931.jzab

Class Zab

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.zk1931.jzab.Zab

  • public class Zab
extends Object
    Zab is a fault-tolerant, replicated protocl that guarantees all requests submitted to it will be delivered in same order to all servers in the cluster. The Zab class exposes all the operation of Jzab library.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Zab(StateMachine stateMachine, ZabConfig config)
      Constructs a Zab instance by recovering from the log directory.

      Constructs a Zab instance by booting from static cluster configuration.
      Zab(StateMachine stateMachine, ZabConfig config, String serverId, String joinPeer)
      Constructs a Zab instance by joining an existing cluster.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Zab

        public Zab(StateMachine stateMachine,
   ZabConfig config)
        Constructs a Zab instance by recovering from the log directory.
        Parameters:
        stateMachine - the state machine implementation of application.
        config - the configuration for Jzab, see ZabConfig.

      • Zab

        public Zab(StateMachine stateMachine,
   ZabConfig config,
   String serverId,
   String joinPeer)
        Constructs a Zab instance by joining an existing cluster. This constructor is supposed to be called only for the very first time to initialize the log directory, once the log directory gets initialized you should call Zab which recovers the Zab instance from log directory.
        Parameters:
        stateMachine - the state machine implementation of application.
        config - the configuration for Jzab, see ZabConfig.
        serverId - ID ("host:port") of this server.
        joinPeer - the ID of peer you want to join in, the ID is a host:port string of the peer. The first server bootstraps the cluster by joining itself.

      • Zab

        public Zab(StateMachine stateMachine,
   ZabConfig config,
   String serverId,
   Set<String> peers)
        Constructs a Zab instance by booting from static cluster configuration. This constructor is supposed to be called only for the very first time to initialize the log directory, once the log directory gets initialized you should call Zab which recovers the Zab instance from log directory.
        Parameters:
        stateMachine - the state machine implementation of application.
        config - the configuration for Jzab, see ZabConfig.
        serverId - ID ("host:port") of this server.
        peers - the IDs of the servers in cluster, including itself.

    • Method Detail

      • getFuture

        public Future<Void> getFuture()
        Get the future of the background working thread of Zab. Users can check the status of the thread via the future.
        Returns:
        the future object of MainThread.

      • send

        public void send(ByteBuffer request,
        Object ctx)
          throws ZabException.NotBroadcastingPhase,
                 ZabException.TooManyPendingRequests
        Submits a request to Zab. Under the hood, followers forward requests to the leader and the leader will be responsible for converting this request to idempotent transaction and broadcasting. If you send request in non-broadcasting phase, the operation will fail.
        Parameters:
        request - the request to send through Zab
        ctx - context to be provided to the callback
        Throws:
        ZabException.NotBroadcastingPhase - if Zab is not in broadcasting phase.
        ZabException.TooManyPendingRequests - if the pending requests exceeds the certain size, for example: if there are more pending requests than ZabConfig.MAX_PENDING_REQS.

      • flush

        public void flush(ByteBuffer request,
         Object ctx)
           throws ZabException.NotBroadcastingPhase,
                  ZabException.TooManyPendingRequests
        Flushes a request through pipeline. The flushed request will be delivered in order with other sending requests, but it will not be convereted to idempotent transaction and will not be persisted in log. And it will only be delivered on the server who issued this request. The purpose of flush is to allow implementing a consistent read-after-write. If you send flush request in non-broadcasting phase, the operation will fail.
        Parameters:
        request - the request to be flushed.
        ctx - context to be provided to the callback
        Throws:
        ZabException.NotBroadcastingPhase - if Zab is not in broadcasting phase.
        ZabException.TooManyPendingRequests - if the pending requests exceeds the certain size, for example: if there are more pending requests than ZabConfig.MAX_PENDING_REQS.

      • remove

        public void remove(String peerId,
          Object ctx)
            throws ZabException.NotBroadcastingPhase,
                   ZabException.TooManyPendingRequests
        Removes a peer from the cluster. If you send remove request in non-broadcasting phase, the operation will fail.
        Parameters:
        peerId - the id of the peer who will be removed from the cluster.
        ctx - context to be provided to the callback
        Throws:
        ZabException.NotBroadcastingPhase - if Zab is not in broadcasting phase.
        ZabException.TooManyPendingRequests - if there is a pending snapshot request.

      • takeSnapshot

        public void takeSnapshot(Object ctx)
                  throws ZabException.NotBroadcastingPhase,
                         ZabException.TooManyPendingRequests
        Issues the request to take a snapshot. The StateMachine.save(java.io.OutputStream) callback will be called for serializing the application's state to disk.
        Parameters:
        ctx - context to be provided to the callback
        Throws:
        ZabException.NotBroadcastingPhase - if Zab is not in broadcasting phase.
        ZabException.TooManyPendingRequests - if there is a pending snapshot request.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
              throws InterruptedException
        Shut down the Zab.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - in case of it's interrupted.

      • getServerId

        public String getServerId()
        Returns the server Id for this Zab instance. The application which recovers from log directory probably needs to know the server Id of Zab.
        Returns:
        the server Id of this Zab instance.
